item.title: 鲍威尔没戏，中国还不够
item.description:
美联储主席在国会的讲话中小心翼翼地避免引起动荡。然而，中国政府可以换个说法。【原文：

The Fed chair carefully avoided creating upheaval in his remarks to Congress. Beijing, however, could do with a change of story.

】

item.title: 菲律宾称两名公民在也门沿海胡塞武装袭击中丧生
item.description: 菲律宾说，胡塞叛军袭击了在红海和亚丁湾航行的船只，导致两名菲律宾海员丧生。【原文：The Philippines said two Filipino seafarers were killed following an attack by Houthi rebels on ships plying the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden.】

item.title: 欧洲央行按兵不动，但预测将增强减息理由：决策指南
item.description: 欧洲中央银行将在第四次会议上保持借贷成本稳定，尽管新的经济预测应该会支持今年晚些时候开始削减借贷成本的论点。【原文：The European Central Bank is set to keep borrowing costs steady for a fourth meeting, though new economic projections should bolster arguments for cuts to start later this year.】

item.title: 木星的下一个巨大挑战是客户退出后的关键人物风险
item.description: 连续六年的客户外流、旋转门式的领导层和数轮裁员，让 Jupiter Fund Management Plc 经历了不少动荡。【原文：With six straight years of client outflows, revolving-door leadership and several rounds of job cuts, Jupiter Fund Management Plc has seen plenty of turmoil.】

item.title: 随着中国贸易的蓬勃发展，俄罗斯将加强著名的东部铁路建设
item.description: 俄罗斯与中国不断增长的贸易帮助其经济抵御了西方的制裁。现在，莫斯科正准备斥资数十亿美元对其庞大的东部铁路进行升级改造，以加快合作的发展。【原文：Russia’s growing trade with China has helped its economy withstand Western sanctions. Now Moscow is preparing to spend billions to upgrade its vast eastern railroads to speed up the burgeoning cooperation.】

item.title: 中国石油进口量在过去两个月中出现季节性下降
item.description: 今年前两个月，中国的石油进口量有所下降，原因是农历新年假期导致季节性冷淡，而且私营炼油厂也推迟了部分采购。【原文：China’s oil imports eased in the first two months of the year on a seasonal lull due to the Lunar New Year break, and as private refiners held off on some purchases.】

item.title: 中国铜冶炼厂将讨论减产问题，因为收费下滑
item.description: 中国最大的铜冶炼企业将于下周在北京举行会议，讨论应对矿石加工费跌至多年来最低水平的措施，包括可能的减产。【原文：China’s biggest copper smelters are set to meet in Beijing next week to discuss measures to counter a plunge in ore processing fees to the lowest level in years, including potential production cuts.】

item.title: 中国大宗商品进口激增，但需求仍有可能落空
item.description: 今年头两个月，中国的原材料采购量激增，因为进口商利用了部分商品价格疲软的机会，并准备从中国政府那里获得更多刺激来提升需求。【原文：China’s raw materials purchases surged in the first two months of the year, as importers took advantage of weaker prices for some commodities and prepared for more stimulus from Beijing to lift demand.】

item.title: 尼日利亚大亨呼吁改革电力行业以重振增长
item.description: 尼日利亚大亨托尼-埃卢梅卢的公司控制着尼日利亚 15%的发电市场，他敦促政府改革电力行业，他说这对重振陷入困境的经济至关重要。【原文：Nigerian tycoon Tony Elumelu, whose firms control 15% of the nation’s electricity generating market, has urged the government to revamp the power industry, which he said was crucial to revive the struggling economy.】

item.title: 易纲提出帮助中国房地产开发商获得 1390 亿美元资金的计划
item.description: 中国前央行行长易纲建议中国房地产开发商使用预售资金的新方式，这可能有助于中国萎靡不振的房地产市场。【原文：China’s former central bank governor Yi Gang has suggested a new way for Chinese real estate developers to use pre-sale funds, which could help the country’s ailing property market.】

item.title: 中国出口大幅增长，为需求带来积极信号
item.description: 2024 年前两个月，中国出口增长速度远超预期，这是世界第二大经济体努力寻找立足点的一个早期、令人鼓舞的需求迹象。【原文：China’s exports grew much faster than expected in the first two months of 2024 in an early, encouraging sign for demand as the world’s second-largest economy tries to find its footing.】

item.title: 日元随银行股上涨，因工资和日本央行讲话提升了加息预期
item.description: 日元攀升至一个月高点，日本银行股上涨，政府债券下跌，原因是工资数据和日本央行董事会成员的讲话刺激了人们对日本央行将在本月加息的猜测。【原文：The yen climbed to a one-month high, Japanese bank shares rose and government bonds dropped as wage data and a Bank of Japan board member’s remarks boosted speculation the central bank will raise interest rates this month.】

item.title: 药明康德、药明生物在美国小组推进禁令法案后股价暴跌
item.description: 在美国参议院一个委员会周三提出一项法案，可能禁止中国生物技术公司和其他一些公司获得联邦合同后，药明康德公司股价暴跌。【原文：WuXi AppTec Co. tumbled after a US Senate committee advanced a bill Wednesday that may ban Chinese biotech firms and some others from federal contracts.】

item.title: 姆努钦用熟悉的剧本和盟友跃入银行动荡之中
item.description: 在史蒂夫-姆努钦（Steve Mnuchin）完成唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的财政部长任期并从海外投资者那里筹集到现金三年后，这位金融家和一位老盟友又开始重拾他们的游戏规则，从一家陷入困境的美国银行挖掘利润。【原文：Three years after Steve Mnuchin finished his term as Donald Trump’s Treasury secretary and raised cash from overseas investors, the financier and an old ally are dusting off their playbook for mining profits from a struggling US bank.】

item.title: 小额贷款投资者发起罕见努力，挑战 10 亿美元交易
item.description: 一群投资者正在对加州大学执政官的 10 亿美元市政债券退款提出质疑。【原文：A group of investors is challenging a $1 billion municipal bond refunding by the Regents of the University of California.】

item.title: Ardian 同意以超过 8.5 亿美元的价格收购 CampusParc
item.description: 据知情人士透露，全球投资公司 Ardian 已同意收购俄亥俄州立大学停车场长期特许经营权的所有者 CampusParc。【原文：Global investment firm Ardian has agreed to acquire CampusParc, the owner of a long-term concession for parking operations at Ohio State University, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美联储影响减弱，亚洲新兴市场债券优先考虑当地因素
item.description: 新兴亚洲的货币和债券走势的同步性正在减弱，因为国内力量开始超过离岸影响。【原文：Currencies and bonds in emerging Asia are moving less in tandem with each other, as domestic forces begin to outweigh offshore influences.】

item.title: 日本央行 3 月会议前日本工资涨幅超预期
item.description: 日本工资增长加速，创下自 6 月份以来的最快增速，为日本央行在短期内结束负利率提供了支持。【原文：Japanese wage growth accelerated to the fastest clip since June, bolstering the case for the Bank of Japan to end its negative interest rate in the near term.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。NYCB 赶上了休息时间。国债市场反弹。杰罗姆-鲍威尔按部就班。美国寻求进一步扼杀中国的芯片准入。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. NYCB catches a break. Treasury market rallies. Jerome Powell sticks to the script. The US seeks to further stifle China’s chip access. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 全球基金追捧印度小鱼，寻找赢家
item.description: 海外投资者希望在印度蓬勃发展的股市中提高收益，他们正在增加对中小市值公司的投资，这些公司的表现优于大型同行。【原文：Overseas investors looking to boost returns in India’s booming stock market are increasing exposure to small- and mid-cap companies that are outperforming larger peers.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将因鲍威尔加息前景而呼应美国股市上涨：市场综述
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示今年的利率可能会下降，受此影响，亚洲股市周四上涨。【原文：Stocks in Asia were set to rise Thursday after US equities gained, helped along by comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell that interest rates will likely fall this year.】

item.title: 雪佛龙重启委内瑞拉关键油田钻探
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）在委内瑞拉的一个原始油田重新开始钻探，以提高产量，而此时华盛顿正威胁要加强对这个受制裁国家的控制。【原文：Chevron Corp. restarted drilling in a pristine field in Venezuela in a bid to increase production just as Washington threatens to tighten its grip on the sanctioned country.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利认为 2024 年将降息两次，也有可能只降息一次
item.description: 2023年11月7日星期二，美国纽约，明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行总裁兼首席执行官尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）在接受采访。卡什卡利表示，决策者尚未赢得对抗通胀的斗争，如有必要，他们将考虑采取更多紧缩措施。摄影师：Victor J. Blue/Bloomberg【原文：Neel Kashkari, president and chief executive officer of the Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis, during an interview in New York, US, on Tuesday, Nov. 7, 2023. Kashkari said policymakers have yet to win the fight against inflation and that they will consider more tightening if needed. Photographer: Victor J. Blue/Bloomberg】

item.title: 穆迪投资者服务公司在品牌重塑中褪去百年旧名
item.description: 穆迪投资者服务公司（Moody's Investors Service）是一家对全球许多公司和政府的债务进行评级的公司，该公司正在改名为穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）。【原文：Moody’s Investors Service, the firm that grades much of the debt from the world’s companies and governments, is rebranding to Moody’s Ratings.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉自 2007 年以来首次出现月度通货紧缩
item.description: 委内瑞拉 2 月份的消费价格在 17 年来首次陷入通货紧缩，这对这个在 2022 年战胜恶性通货膨胀的国家来说是一个转折点。【原文：Venezuela’s consumer prices slipped into deflation in February for the first time in 17 years, a tipping point for the nation that conquered hyperinflation in 2022.】

item.title: 欧洲央行试图安抚因思想自由而 "震惊 "的员工
item.description: 2023年12月19日星期二，欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员弗兰克-埃尔德森在德国法兰克福举行的新闻发布会上。欧洲中央银行表示，明年该地区贷款机构的资本要求将从10.7%上升至11.1%，这反映了宏观审慎政策的影响。【原文：Frank Elderson, executive board member of the European Central Bank, during a news conference in Frankfurt, Germany, on Tuesday, Dec. 19, 2023. The European Central Bank said capital requirements for the region’s lenders will rise to 11.1% next year from 10.7%, reflecting the impact of macroprudential policies.】

item.title: 德意志银行聘请佩雷拉的安迪-谭（Andy Tam）担任保险业务联席主管
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，德意志银行聘请 Perella Weinberg Partners 董事总经理 Andy Tam 担任美洲保险业务联席主管，与 Scott Littlejohn 并肩作战。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG hired Perella Weinberg Partners managing director Andy Tam as co-head of Americas insurance alongside Scott Littlejohn, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 鲍威尔支持维持现状，美元跌至一个月来最低点
item.description: 由于美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）重申了他的货币政策计划，以及油价上涨提振了大宗商品生产商，美元兑几乎所有其他主要货币都在下滑。【原文：The dollar is sliding against nearly all other major currencies as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell reiterated his plans for monetary policy — and as higher oil prices boosted commodity producers.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚武契奇称总理将在改组中下台
item.description: 塞尔维亚总统亚历山大-武契奇（Aleksandar Vucic）说，安娜-布尔纳比奇（Ana Brnabic）将在领导政府近七年后辞去总理职务，转任议会议长。【原文：Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said Ana Brnabic will step down as prime minister to become parliamentary speaker after leading the government for almost seven years.】

item.title: 英国计划在水资源最紧张的城镇之一建立信贷系统
item.description: 作为政府管理稀缺资源努力的一部分，英格兰水资源最紧张地区之一的建筑开发商将被要求为新建住宅购买和出售水信用额度。【原文：Building developers in one of England’s most water-stressed areas will be required to buy and sell water credits for new homes as part of a government effort to manage the scarce resource.】
